Human aging is a biological process that occurs as cells in the body gradually deteriorate. This decline can lead to a variety of age-related health problems. As we age, our cells' ability to divide and replace themselves is reduced, leading to the accumulation of damaged cells and the eventual breakdown of tissues. The human body also undergoes natural changes such as the loss of muscle mass, reduced bone density, and decreased cognitive function. These changes can affect physical and mental abilities, making daily activities more challenging. Proper nutrition, regular exercise, and good healthcare can help slow down or prevent some age-related health issues.
